A man read a book called "Inner Journey", which touched him very much. This is a book about self-discovery. He believes that this book touches his heart and is worth reading. He called on everyone to share good books with each other.

In this highly digitalized era, the author attempts digital detoxification. He created technology-free places in his home, his dining room and bedroom, which improved his sleep quality and improved his appetite. He also tries to do some focused work in the morning instead of grabbing a device, such as reading a physics book or going for a walk.

The author tries to focus on cooking. He concentrates on feeling the colors and flavors of the ingredients while cooking. This cooking method makes him no longer regard cooking as a tiring labor but a kind of enjoyment, and the food produced in this way is also more delicious.
How to carry less stuff when traveling i.e. simplify your luggage. This can be accomplished by making a list.

The government launched a bicycle program, deploying five hundred bicycles and equipping them with navigation systems and more effective safety systems. The number of cyclists has increased by 20%, which can effectively improve the problems of environmental pollution and traffic congestion, and promote national sports. In the future, the government plans to further promote the program and make cycling a part of urban culture.

The school will launch a robotics activity to inspire students' passion for STEM. Students will have the opportunity to operate robots and participate in major competitions. The school will partner with some technology companies to successfully host the event. The principal and parents expressed support for the event.

The government will promote the previous garden plan and add five more gardens to the original 20 urban gardens. Citizens can grow vegetables and fruits in the garden under the guidance of volunteers. The garden will be equipped with advanced automated farming systems. Government officials expressed support for the plan. Urban gardens can add green to the city, alleviate air pollution and beautify the city.

Hello everyone! I made three moves to make my life more sustainable. The first is not using single-use plastic: I now use recyclable bags to store items. The second is to reduce food purchases: buying too much food will lead to waste, so I only buy what I need to eat. The third is to build a compost bin in the garden so that I can collect and utilize organic waste. Sustainable development is very important. I am curious about how you make your life sustainable. I hope to hear what you share.

I have been exercising for a while and found three important factors to maintain exercise. The first is a clear plan, which allows me to focus on my daily progress and gain satisfaction. The second is exercise partners, which can introduce social elements into exercise and stimulate your own exercise through peers; we have a exercise group where everyone encourages each other. The third is to pay attention to rest. It is important to continue to exercise, but proper rest and relaxation are also essential. I hope everyone can get active!

I would like to recommend a book called The journey within. This book tells the story of a protagonist’s journey on the emotional land. This book helped me learn a lot and start thinking about my own life choices. Rarely do I come across a book that is as entertaining as it is thought-provoking. I'm curious if any of you have read this book. Please share your reading experiences with me.

In today's information society, when we try to break away from electronic products, we find it very difficult but very rewarding. Digital detox doesn’t mean not using electronics at all, but finding a balance. I tried digital detox for a while. I established electronics-free zones in my home, especially in my bedroom and dining room; I noticed that the quality of my sleep and diet improved. I also try to find myself something practical to do every morning, like reading and exercising, instead of going straight to my phone. After digital detoxing for a while, my focus increased and I also found that I had more time to develop my hobbies.

Compared with simply cooking, I have recently fallen in love with the activity of cooking, which can calm my mind. I feel very peaceful when I feel the taste of the ingredients, the softness of the dough, and listen to the sound of cooking. I think I have fallen in love with this activity.

I now prefer to travel minimally, usually only carrying necessary clothing and items that can be used multiple times, and put them in a backpack. What minimalist travel requires most is careful planning. Now, I can spend more time enjoying the scenery instead of taking care of my luggage, which makes my trip more meaningful.

The city has helped reduce traffic jams by expanding its bicycle program (adding 500 new bikes and adding parking spots) and launching public safety campaigns to teach safe bicycling techniques, along with the distribution of helmets.

The school launched a project called STEM this week, which refers to science, technology, electronics, and mathematics. It includes activities for students to build robots independently. There will also be activities related to electronics and problem-solving later. This activity is supported by technology companies. The principal is very optimistic about this project because he feels that it can expose students to cutting-edge technology. Parents believe that this will help students enter the rapidly changing workplace. This project will be expanded in the coming years.

There are now 20 community garden projects, and five more will be added next year. These gardens add a green space to busy communities, reduce carbon footprints, and promote food production. The garden has raised flower beds for easy planting, which promotes neighborly relations, and volunteers teach planting techniques. The garden was built with funding from the city and local businesses.

The speaker talked about the sustainable changes he has made, including reducing reliance on single-use plastics, reducing food waste, setting up compost bins in the backyard, and the benefits of these changes to him and the environment. Travel is one of the things that the author feels passionate about. Years of travel experience have taught him to travel minimally. The first step in minimalist travel is to plan carefully, including packing multi-functional items to make your luggage more comfortable. lighter. Lighter luggage makes the travel experience better. The author feels that the memories of travel are much more important than the things you buy while traveling.

In this era of rapid development of the Internet and rampant electronics, it is very difficult to take a step back and stay away from the Internet. But reducing your reliance on the internet is well worth it. This does not mean that you do not need technology at all, but that you can achieve a balance between technology and reality. I recently made an attempt to get away from the digital world and to be more connected to the real world. The first step is to create an electronics-free space at home, especially in the bedroom and living room. This has improved my sleep quality and allowed me to eat well in restaurants more often. I encourage everyone to try this, at least by browsing less social media.

Cooking with heart is something worth enjoying. Unlike cooking in a hurry, cooking with heart makes me pay more attention to the fresh vegetables, paying attention to the color, taste and texture of the vegetables. This is very relaxing and a very interesting activity.

I used to pack a lot of things when I traveled. Recently, I like to travel minimally and only bring necessary items. This allows me to focus more on the travel experience and local culture rather than material things.
